activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mathew E. Smith

records.addlTxt:
1:49 PM Defendant Mathew E. Smith appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Mathew E. Smith. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Rhinelander Patrol Sergeant/Chad Brown /sworn/direct by Schiek/witness identifies defendant/continued direct by Schiek/cross by Magallones/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones requests a separate arraignment date. Bond continued. adj. 02:01 PM
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Must enter treatment at the Joshua Glover House and cooperate with treatment

10:11 AM Defendant Mathew E. Smith appeared by video. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Mathew E. Smith. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states witness is unavailable - would like to amend bond to a signature bond - defendant accepted into treatment program. Magallones statement to treatment. Court amends bond to a signature bond with conditions. adj. 10:16 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:53 PM Defendant Mathew E. Smith appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Breanna Magallones appearing in court. Magallones states Defendant is eligible for PD - has not had time to do a conflict check. Copy of complaint provided to Magallones. Magallones reviews. Magallones states she will represent - no conflict. Schiek/Magallones statement to bond. Court sets bond. Magallones requests preliminary hearing. adj. 01:57 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
